results.definition: A designation identifying certain unclassified but sensitive information that may be exempt from public release under the Freedom of Information Act.

A designation used by the U.S. DOE to identify information that:

  • is unclassified,
  • has the potential to damage governmental, commercial, or private interests if disseminated to persons who do not need the information to perform their jobs or other DOE-authorized activities, and
  • Fall under at least one of eight Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) exemptions (exemptions 2 through 9; information falling under exemption 1 can never be OUO because it covers information classified by Executive order). For a list of the nine FOIA exemptions, see IM100.2.5, Identify and Protect Unclassified Information.

Note: Information that meets the definition of Sandia Proprietary is not considered OUO.
Abcoulomb (Electromagnetic Unit)
Aberdeen Proving Ground (Maryland)
Absiemen (Formerly Abmho)
Used to expedite procurement of standard, Firm-Fixed Price commercial items valued at $100,000 or less.
Used to expedite procurement of standard, Firm-Fixed Price commercial items valued at $100,000 or less.
See also Advanced Simulation and Computing Program (ASC)
See CPS Dictionary Term for Acceptable entry reference level.
Acceptable Intake for Chronic (Exposure)
Acceptable Intake for Subchronic (exposure)

An offer is acceptable when it manifests the Offeror's assent without exception to any of the requirements of the solicitation or when SNL's best interest may be met through successful negotiation of any exceptions.
Acceptance Required (Stamp)

(acceptable level of risk) The acknowledgment that a protection system may not achieve 100 percent protection against all occurrences, but further improvement in the system is not justified, and that DOE is willing to allow a low probability of an occurrence resulting in a significant loss/consequence event.

Includes any of the following:

  • The knowledge, use, or possession of classified or other sensitive information required by an individual to perform official duties that is provided to the individual on a need-to-know basis.
  • The ability and opportunity to obtain knowledge of classified information.
  • Situations that may provide an individual proximity to or control over special nuclear material.
  • The proximity to a nuclear weapon and/or special nuclear material in such a manner as to allow the opportunity to divert, steal, tamper with and/or damage the weapon or material.
  • Ability and means to communicate with (i.e., input to or receive output from), or otherwise make use of any information, resource, or component in a Classified Automated Information System.
An administrative determination that an individual is eligible for access to classified matter or is eligible for access to, or control over, special nuclear material.
Clearance and badging system
Access Control Point (use ECP - entry control point)

results.term: Access National Agency Check and Inquiries

results.definition: https://snl-wiki.sandia.gov/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=66257183#
An unintended event or sequence of events that causes death, physical injury or damage to the health of people, or damage to property or the environment.
When an employee is on assignment (TDY, EDY, or IDY) with at least one other member of his or her immediate family.

A ten-digit numeric code used to organize and identify the five categories of accounts that are used by Sandia.

 

Account CategoriesTen-digit Numeric Code
Assets0000000000 to 1999999999
Liabilities2000000000 to 2999999999
Equity3000000000 to 3999999999
Revenues5000000000 to 5999999999
Expenses6000000000 to 6999999999
A system which audits the control measures provided through the use of a verifiable inventory and the establishment of a custodial chain.
The tracking of the physical location and amounts of all reportable quantities of nuclear material per DOE Order 5633.3A, "Control and Accountability of Nuclear Materials."

Person who has possession of, is charged with, or otherwise has assigned responsibility for the control and accountability of the following types of classified matter:

  • Top Secret matter
  • Any matter that requires accountability because of national, international, or programmatic requirements:
    • National requirements such as cryptography and designated Communications Security (COMSEC)
    • International requirements such as North American Treaty Organization (NATO), ATOMAL, designated United Kingdom documents, or other Foreign Government Information (FGI) designated in international agreements.

A classified document that meets at least one of the following criteria:

  • Top Secret classified document.
  • Classified document for which accountability is required as a result of a DOE directive, national, international, or programmatic requirements including:
    • Cryptography and designated COMSEC.
    • NATO ATOMAL.
    • Designated United Kingdom information.
    • Foreign Government Information designated in international agreements.
    • Special access programs (e.g., designated SAPs).

The following are types of accountable matter:

  1. Top Secret matter
  2. Sigma 14 matter
  3. Any matter that requires accountability because of national, international, or programmatic requirements:
    1. National requirements such as cryptography and designated Communications Security (COMSEC)
    2. International requirements such as North American Treaty Organization (NATO) ATOMAL, designated United Kingdom documents, or other Foreign Government Information (FGI) designated in international agreements.
  4. Designated special access programs.
A tool for managing accountable matter.

CREM becomes ACREM when it stores one of the following types of information:
  • Top Secret (TS).
  • Secret Restricted Data (SRD).
  • All Sigma 14 and Sigma 15.

Classified electronic media are those materials and components manufactured for the purpose of providing non-volatile storage of classified digital data capable of being read by a computer. ?Removable? refers to such media that are:
  • Designed to be introduced to and removed from the computer without adverse impact on computer functions.
  • Separated from the computer for any reason.
  • Portable electronic devices including laptop computers with fixed internal hard drives.

Certain material types have been designated by the Secretary of Energy as accountable, which means that they must be tracked and subject to an audit system when the quantity meets or exceeds the accou

All materials so designated by the Secretary of Energy (i.e., depleted uranium, enriched uranium, americium-241, americium-243, curium, berkelium, californium-252, plutonium-238 through -242, lithium-6, uranium-233, normal uranium, neptunium-237, deuterium, tritium, and thorium), when the quantity of the material meets or exceeds accountability thresholds. ANM includes two subsets of nuclear material: Special Nuclear Material (SNM) and Other Accountable Nuclear Material.

[Printing & copying def.] The person upon whom the responsibility rests to assure conformance to the standard is maintained. This is the person on whom the consequences for non-compliance shall be levied.

[Facilities def.] Member of the Workforce who acquires or retains facility-type drawings and information, holds full liability for the life-cycle of facility-type drawings and/or information and is the chargeable presence in mishandling and determination of facility-type drawings and information.

Sandia's accounting system, an Oracle Financial Applications system, uses multiple modules to process different types of accounting transactions. The different modules include Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Assets, ETK/WebER, Financial Management Reporting, General Ledger, Inventory, Management Reporting, Manufacturing, MIS-FIS, Project Accounting, Procurement and the Travel & Treasury System.
Adjustments necessary to correct the accounting classification of cost transactions.

Data associated with commitments and cost transactions found in the Oracle Financial Information System (FIS). Data associated with costs charged to expense accounts includes:

  • what project and task was charged (including Service Orders (SOs) and holding projects, and A-order projects).
  • what type of cost was incurred - expenditure type.
  • who incurred the cost - charging organization.

The Accounts Payable Organization is responsible for making timely and accurate payments to Sandia's supplier community.  Accounts Payable is also responsible for processing Cost Transfers, Commitment Reclasses, Check Requests, Nonemployee Expense Vouchers and ensuring compliance to reporting requirements (IRS and other oversight).

The formal written acknowledgment of the decision by the designated accrediting authority to authorize an information system to process, store, transfer, or provide access to classified information in a specific information system's security environment established by a specific system security plan. Accreditation of unclassified computing resources is performed by the SNL Information System Security Site Manager (ISSM). Accreditation of classified resources is performed by a NNSA official upon recommendation by the ISSM.

An estimate of goods or services provided by a supplier on a contract through the current date. Whether a supplier has or has not billed Sandia is irrelevant. For example, if a supplier has completed half of the work on a contract, half of the costs should be accrued.
A method of accounting in which costs are recognized in the month and year incurred, regardless of when payment is made.
The dollar amount charged to a project based on an estimate of goods or services provided by a supplier prior to receipt of invoice.

Collection of characterized, compatible wastes in a designated accumulation point.

(with extra info added...)

Obtaining goods/services for Sandia's use by any of a variety of procurement methods. Strategic Contracting Representatives have ultimate authority to bind and obligate Sandia.

[Fleet Services def] - Purchase (P.O., P-card or other means), lease-to-own, rent or lease for other than business travel, transfer to SNL from another government agency, transfer from another SNL organization, or act of obtaining through the General Services Administration (GSA), of a government vehicle or motorized equipment.
Acquisition CCB - Air Force Technical Applications Center (AFTAC)
The process in which the SCR and the Requester gather all of the data necessary to plan a successful procurement.
Actinon (Chemical Symbol)
Actinouranium (Nuclear Physics)
Executive Action Items: https://sharepoint.sandia.gov/sites/AIMS/Lists/AI/AllItems.aspx

The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) published chemical specific averaged 8-hour exposure level (concentration in air) which is typically one half the Permissible Exposure Limit (PEL).

results.term: Active Rate Reducer and Inflation System
Active Remote Sensing of Cloud Locations

results.definition: A distinct component of work performed during the course of a project.

The activity data sheet (ADS) supports the Environmental, Restoration, Planning, Budgeting, and Control System and relates to the program summary work breakdown structure (WBS) at a specified level. It is the basic building block for program life-cycle planning. An assessment ADS and a cleanup ADS define a remediation project. Management activities that are not associated with a specific remediation project are specified on separate ADSs.
Actual Finish Date

A formally defined group of individuals participating in a specific activity or project or group of activities or projects in which all members have been determined to have the appropriate access authorization, any required formal access approvals, and need-to-know.

results.term: Ada based Design and Documentation Language
Adaptive Processor Seismic Acoustic Helicopter Detector
Adaptive Processor Seismic Personnel Intrusion Detector
Additional Costs That Would Offset Savings
results.definition: An example is when in order to accept the lowest logical airfare, a different departure/return airport must be used which requires the employee to take public transportation rather than a personal vehicle. If the cost of using public transportation is more than the difference in airfares, the traveler is not required to accept the lowest logical airfare.

An account set up in the Material Control and Accountability (MC&A) database to track Other Accountable Nuclear Material (ANM). Each Administrative Area (AA) is identified by the responsible program and will have a primary point of contact (POC); alternate POCs, if needed; and a designated manager. These AA-related individuals have access to the material and act as MC&A interfaces. AA POCs also have responsibility for knowing where the material is located at all times.

Any revision to Corporate Policy System documents that do not alter document requirements and do not require formal review and approval.  Administrative changes do not change who does the work or how it is done.  Examples include: 

  • Adding/updating hyperlinks.
  • Revising subject matter experts or other contact.
  • Changing the name of a table or a form in a procedure.
  • Updating a form, figure, or flowchart associated with the document.
  • Improving wording (grammar and syntax) or correcting errors (including correction of typographical errors).
  • Adding optional training.
  • Total reformatting of a section, or entire document if no changes are made to requirements.
  • Relocating a procedure from one process area to another process area within the same policy area.
  • Changing the name of a corporate policy, process, or procedure.

A term used by the Department of Energy (DOE) to designate the level of Budget and Reporting (B&R) line number at which projects will be held financially accountable; i.e., costs may not exceed funding.

The provisions relating to organization and management, procedures, record keeping, assessment, and reporting necessary to ensure safe operation of a facility. Specific values, conditions, or range of parameters within which a facility operator has proposed to operate the facility and DOE has accepted during its review of the facility authorization basis.
Administrative Terminal System (Computers)
ADSN Telesis File Transfer Program (Security Barrier)
A Sandia support group

A procedure for shortening procurement cycle time by allowing the SCR (Sandia Contracting Rep.) to begin the procurement cycle before receiving the Requestor’s fully approved (funded) PR (purchase requisition). If funding is not yet available, the Oracle PR shall be approved with .01 in the Quantity field for “Amount” based PRs or 0 in the Price field for “Quantity” based PRs. Before placing the contract, the SCR must receive an approved PR with funding included.
Advances of money less than full payment prior to performing work or incurring cost for the purpose of complete performance under a contract or contracts.

results.definition: Upward movement by a non-represented employee to a higher level within the same job category or from a nonexempt category to a non-managerial exempt job category.
An individual, group, organization or government whose objectives are counter to ours and must be denied critical and sensitive information. Also commonly referred to as a competitor or enemy.

Business concerns are affiliates of each other when, either directly or indirectly, one concern or individual controls or has the power to control another, or when a third party controls or has the power to control both.
Specific efforts by management to enhance the participation of legally protected groups that historically have been underrepresented in the workforce.

(annual percentage goals) - A percentage target for hiring or promoting minorities or women in job groups where deficiencies exist during a fiscal year. For purposes of an affirmative action program, goals are set equal to total weighted availability.

Aspects of the contractor's employment decisions, policies, or practices that appear to raise questions regarding the contractor's compliance with Executive Order 11246, Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act, or the Vietnam-Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA).
A written program, meeting the federal requirements, in which a contractor annually details the steps it will take, and has already taken, to ensure equal employment opportunity.

Basic Ordering Agreements are specially designed to meet the procurement needs of DOE Contractors. The agreements range from computer hardware/software to copier maintenance and supplies, and are available for use by DOE contractors. DOE employees interested in any of the agreements should contact the Agreement Administrator for information on specific award criteria and terms and conditions.

results.term: Air Accommodations not Reasonably Available to Meet Mission Requirements
results.definition: Air accommodations are not reasonably available to meet mission requirements when a lowest logical airfare (LLA) ticket is not available for purchase for the departure and/or arrival times needed to perform the mission requirements.
